title.narrative: WASH:HUMANITARIAN ACTION & RESILIENCE

description.narrative: Girls, boys and women in vulnerable and emergency affected populations including those in IDP and refugee camps have access to quality and timely safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene facilities., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Mothers, children and adolescents affected by humanitarian crisis, emergencies and disease outbreaks access high-impact/ life- saving cost effective proven interventions (WASH-HEALTH/NUTRITION) and Education and Child Protection interventions with an equitable, gender and participatory approach.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, boys and women in vulnerable and emergency affected populations including those in IDP and refugee camps have access toquality and timely safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene facilities.
Emergency affected population with access to functional appropriately designed toilets & sanitation services
Children with access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene facilities in their learning environment and child friendly spaces
